data.title: Round and round we go
data.solution:
from collections import OrderedDict

n = int(input())
rules = OrderedDict()
for i in range(n):
  passing_rule = input()
  assert passing_rule.count(" passes the ball to ") == 1, passing_rule
  passer, receiver = passing_rule.split(" passes the ball to ")
  assert all(first_letter.upper() == first_letter for first_letter,*_ in passer.split()), passer
  assert all(first_letter.upper() == first_letter for first_letter,*_ in receiver.split()), receiver
  rules[receiver] = passer

# Test that everyone is in the loop
names = [next(iter(rules))]
for i in range(n):
  names.append(rules[names[-1]])
assert names[0] == names[-1], names
assert len(set(names)) == n, names

# Print result
for passer in rules.values():
  print(passer, "passes the ball to", rules[passer])
data.statement:
Kids are passing a ball among themselves while standing in a big circle. Whenever someone gets the ball they always pass it to the person mentioned in the puzzle input so that the ball travels in a big loop that visits everyone.

Now they want to change things up and <<reverse the direction of the ball>>. Help them figure out who to pass the ball to now.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Kids are passing a ball among themselves while standing in a big circle. Whenever someone gets the ball they always pass it to the person mentioned in the puzzle input so that the ball travels in a big loop that visits everyone.

Now they want to change things up and reverse the direction of the ball. Help them figure out who to pass the ball to now.
Input
LIne 1: An integer N for the number of kids playing.
Next N lines: Rule description for passing the ball in the form of
name1 passes the ball to name2
Output
N lines: Rule description for passing the ball in the opposite direction in the same format as and order as input i.e. the line should start with the same name as the corresponding line of input.
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 20

Name constraints:
* All names are unique.
* Each name is composed of one or more words (e.g. first name, middle name, last name, title,...).
* No part of a name will start with a lower case letter.
* Full name will be at most 300 characters.
Example
Input
4
Michelangelo passes the ball to Raphael
Donatello passes the ball to Leonardo
Leonardo passes the ball to Michelangelo
Raphael passes the ball to Donatello
Output
Michelangelo passes the ball to Leonardo
Donatello passes the ball to Raphael
Leonardo passes the ball to Donatello
Raphael passes the ball to Michelangelo
